conclusion: An electromagnetic railgun fire truck utilizes electromagnetic propulsion technology to launch fire extinguishing projectiles into high-rise buildings for rapid fire suppression. The energy stored in capacitors is converted into the kinetic energy of the projectile through electromagnetic induction. By setting the working voltage of the energy storage capacitors, the desired muzzle velocity of the projectile can be achieved. The railgun is aimed directly at a high-rise building, with a horizontal distance L=60m between them. The muzzle velocity of the projectile is v0=50m/s, and the launch angle relative to the horizontal plane is θ=53°. Neglecting the height of the railgun above the ground and air resistance, and taking the acceleration due to gravity as g=10m/s², and sin53°=0.8.
The image shows a fire truck equipped with a railgun aimed at a high-rise building. The diagram indicates the horizontal distance L and the angle θ of the projectile.
The horizontal component of the initial velocity is v_x0 = 30 m/s.
The time t it takes for the projectile to travel the horizontal distance is t = 2 s.
The vertical component of the initial velocity is v_y0 = 40 m/s.
The height H above the ground at which the projectile hits the high-rise building is H = 60 m.
